p: Indolicidin, a cathelicidin isolated from large granules of bovine neutrophils, was the first to show anti-HIV activity (Robinson et al. 1998). It is thought that the potent antimicrobial properties of indolicidin are related to their ability to disrupt pathogen membranes. Experimentally, indolicidin directly inactivated the HIV-1 virus particles, an observation that was attributed to a membrane-mediated antiviral mechanism.
